I looked at the proportion of the balls of certain colour and tried to figure it outwhat will be a sufficient number to be representative. In some instances where the boxes seemed to have same proportion of balls i figure it out that even a low number of balls is sufficient as was mostly a matter of luck

i eyeballed the ratio of white to coloured balls in each box. if the difference in colour ratio was large between the two boxes, then i made my estimate lower because the probability would be higher for me to guess correctly (e.g., one box has 90 white balls and 10 pink, whereas the other has 90 pink balls and 10 white. if there are 9 pink and 1 white in the bowl, i can safely guess that it must be the box with a majority of pink balls). if i could not differentiate between the amounts in the boxes, or it was only a slight difference, i would need more balls to know the answer.

When the numbers of the lesser colour were low, I was hedging my bets and covering all angles by picking the full amount, but when the numbers of the differing colours were more even, I was calculating the colour of half the box.
feedback: No, only I wish I could have played on to see how I would have done.
